name: George Washington
details: Led during the American Revolutionary War and established many governmental precedents.

name: John Adams
details: Played a key role in the drafting of the Declaration of Independence and was known for his legal expertise.

name: Thomas Jefferson
details: Principal author of the Declaration of Independence and oversaw the Louisiana Purchase.

name: James Madison
details: 'Father of the Constitution' and led the U.S. during the War of 1812.

name: James Monroe
details: Known for the Monroe Doctrine which opposed European colonialism in the Americas.

name: John Quincy Adams
details: Advocated for modernizing the American economy and was a strong opponent of slavery.

name: Andrew Jackson
details: Founder of the Democratic Party and known for his controversial policies regarding Native Americans.

name: Martin Van Buren
details: Known for his role in establishing the modern Democratic Party.

name: William Henry Harrison
details: Died only a month into his presidency, the shortest tenure of any U.S. president.

name: John Tyler
details: First vice president to succeed to the presidency after the death of a sitting president.

name: James K. Polk
details: Oversaw the expansion of U.S. territory through the Mexican-American War.

name: Zachary Taylor
details: A national war hero for his battles in the Mexican-American War.

name: Millard Fillmore
details: Supported the Compromise of 1850 which sought to ease tensions between slave and free states.

name: Franklin Pierce
details: Known for his support of the Kansas-Nebraska Act, which heightened tensions over slavery.

name: James Buchanan
details: Presidency saw the nation head toward Civil War due to his inaction on slavery.

name: Abraham Lincoln
details: Led the U.S. during the Civil War and issued the Emancipation Proclamation to abolish slavery.

name: Andrew Johnson
details: Oversaw the early Reconstruction era and was the first president to be impeached.

name: Ulysses S. Grant
details: Civil War hero who worked to stabilize the post-war economy and protect civil rights.

name: Rutherford B. Hayes
details: Ended Reconstruction and sought to restore national unity after the Civil War.

name: James A. Garfield
details: Known for his efforts in civil service reform, but was assassinated early in his term.

name: Chester A. Arthur
details: Championed civil service reform and the Pendleton Act to curb government corruption.

name: Grover Cleveland
details: The only president to serve two non-consecutive terms, known for his honesty and integrity.

name: Benjamin Harrison
details: Supported protective tariffs and sought to modernize the U.S. Navy.

name: William McKinley
details: Led the U.S. during the Spanish-American War, which resulted in U.S. territorial expansion.

name: Theodore Roosevelt
details: Known for his progressive policies and conservation efforts, and for building the Panama Canal.

name: William Howard Taft
details: Later became Chief Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court, known for his trust-busting policies.

name: Woodrow Wilson
details: Led the U.S. through World War I and was instrumental in founding the League of Nations.

name: Warren G. Harding
details: Known for his 'Return to Normalcy' campaign and the Teapot Dome scandal.

name: Calvin Coolidge
details: Known for his laissez-faire policies during the Roaring Twenties.

name: Herbert Hoover
details: Presidency was defined by the Great Depression and his response to the economic crisis.

name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
details: Led the U.S. through the Great Depression and World War II with his New Deal programs.

name: Harry S. Truman
details: Made the decision to drop atomic bombs on Japan and implemented the Marshall Plan.

name: Dwight D. Eisenhower
details: Led post-war America during a period of economic growth and infrastructure development.

name: John F. Kennedy
details: Known for his handling of the Cuban Missile Crisis and advancing the space race.

name: Lyndon B. Johnson
details: Passed landmark civil rights legislation and escalated U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War.

name: Richard Nixon
details: Known for the Watergate scandal and being the only president to resign from office.

name: Gerald Ford
details: Became president after Nixonâ€™s resignation and sought to restore public confidence in government.

name: Jimmy Carter
details: Promoted human rights and brokered the Camp David Accords in the Middle East.

name: Ronald Reagan
details: Known for conservative policies, Reaganomics, and helping to end the Cold War.

name: George H. W. Bush
details: Led the U.S. during the Gulf War and oversaw the end of the Cold War.

name: Bill Clinton
details: Presided over a period of economic expansion but was impeached for perjury and obstruction.

name: George W. Bush
details: Known for his response to the 9/11 attacks and initiating the Iraq War.

name: Barack Obama
details: First African American president, known for the Affordable Care Act and killing of Osama bin Laden.

name: Donald Trump
details: Known for his 'America First' policies, and his two impeachments during his presidency.

name: Joe Biden
details: Focused on tackling the COVID-19 pandemic and passing large infrastructure and economic recovery bills.
